translated: I was a reciter and a memorizer,
I was surrounded by my students
when I approached the supreme human.
Padumuttara, the knower of the world,
the receiver of offerings,🔽the Great Seer in brief
I bowed down to the Teacher;🔽raising my hands in respectful salutation,
and had confidence in the Buddha.
and in the same way in detail;
I was skilled in the Abhidhamma method,
in the purification of the topic of discussion;
four of them will be well-known;
they will be rulers over the four continents.
The six direct knowledges have been realized,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā puṇṇo mantāṇiputto thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā puṇṇaḥ mantāṇiputto theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus has it been heard by me: The Elder named Puṇṇa, the son of Mantāṇi, recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta is the fifth.
